channel.title: hide torbrowser-launcher inside Whonix start menu
channel.description:
Now this ia a bit weird. By installing onionshare by default, it pulls torbrowser-launcher, which results in two more Tor icons in the start menu under internet. Usability issue. This would certainly make people wonder which is the right Tor Browser icon to click to start Tor Browser.
(Currently happening in [Whonix 14.0.0.2.6 developers only](https://forums.whonix.org/t/whonix-14-0-0-2-6-developers-only).)
I wonder what should be done about this. Should tb-starter perhaps config-package-dev displace and thereby hide these desktop icons?
(And if you are wondering why we are using tb-updater rather than torbrowser-launcher in Whonix, see this thread: https://forums.whonix.org/t/using-torbrowser-launcher-instead-of-tb-updater-in-whonix)

item.title: hide torbrowser-launcher inside Whonix start menu
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
github.com/Whonix/tb-starter

Revert "hide /usr/share/applications/torbrowser.desktop" 

This reverts commit 8bb4a0f2729ea293c43143d0ad0a85f8d0082c10.
by adrelanos on 07:47PM - 28 Mar 17
changed 4 files with 2 additions and 20 deletions.
github.com/Whonix/tb-starter

add "Provides: torbrowser-launcher" to prevent it being pulled needlessly by onionshare 

https://forums.whonix.org/t/hide-torbrowser-launcher-inside-whonix-start-menu
by adrelanos on 08:07PM - 28 Mar 17
changed 1 files with 1 additions and 0 deletions.

Read full topic
item.source: hide torbrowser-launcher inside Whonix start menu

item.title: hide torbrowser-launcher inside Whonix start menu
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
This is done.

github.com/Whonix/tb-starter

hide /usr/share/applications/torbrowser.desktop 

hide /usr/share/applications/torbrowser-settings.desktop
https://forums.whonix.org/t/hide-torbrowser-launcher-inside-whonix-start-menu
by adrelanos on 01:40AM - 10 Mar 17
changed 4 files with 20 additions and 2 deletions.

Read full topic

[feature request] onionshare support

I wonder what should be done about this. Should tb-starter perhaps config-package-dev displace and thereby hide these desktop icons?

Yes sounds good.

item.title: hide torbrowser-launcher inside Whonix start menu
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Now this ia a bit weird. By installing onionshare by default, it pulls torbrowser-launcher, which results in two more Tor icons in the start menu under internet. Usability issue. This would certainly make people wonder which is the right Tor Browser icon to click to start Tor Browser.

(Currently happening in Whonix 14.0.0.2.6 developers only.)

I wonder what should be done about this. Should tb-starter perhaps config-package-dev displace and thereby hide these desktop icons?

(And if you are wondering why we are using tb-updater rather than torbrowser-launcher in Whonix, see this thread:
https://forums.whonix.org/t/using-torbrowser-launcher-instead-of-tb-updater-in-whonix)
